bibl.title: Melody and Word Accent Relationships in Ancient Greek Musical Documents: The Pitch Height Rule. Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.note: A statistical method of interpretation through computer simulation applied to the musical texts, focusing on the convention of correlating a word's accent with the highest pitch level in the melody for that word: the Pitch Hight Rule.
bibl.seg: COSGROVE Charles H. and Mary C. MEYER, Melody and Word Accent Relationships in Ancient Greek Musical Documents: The Pitch Height Rule. Avec résumé en anglais.

A statistical method of interpretation through computer simulation applied to the musical texts, focusing on the convention of correlating a word's accent with the highest pitch level in the melody for that word: the Pitch Hight Rule.
